turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: ...the pathologist... he said that you had reported a similar incident... with a cat...

turns.speaker: YOLANDER
turns.text: The Creed cat, that's right. Bastard's name was "Church".  Let me guess. Your dog's tissue isn't healing, pupils aren't dilating... maybe you can't find a heartbeat?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Exactly! I thought it might be some sort of blood condition... immune deficiency or...

turns.speaker: YOLANDER
turns.text: You want some advice, friend? You get in your car, you pick up your family... and you get the hell out of that town.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Well... uh... thanks...

turns.speaker: YOLANDER
turns.text: Believe what you saw, Matthews. The dog was dead.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: My God...  ...how is that possible? You have to help me, Doctor Yolander. I don't know what I'm dealing with here! They've dug up my wife...

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Did she always have reporters following her around like this?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Pretty much so.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: I hear you moved into town.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I wanted to get Geoff out of L.A. Just start things over, you know?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: That's Renee alright.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: I suppose so.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: When I was young I thought cats were the girls and dogs were the boys.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: There are three more girls where that one came from looking for homes.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Thee facial lacerations should heal up pretty quickly. I'll give you som antibiotic cream--

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: --Drew, he's your dog. Are you listening to this?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: I hear you've got Marjorie Hargrove working for you now.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: How'd you know that?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: I was building a doggy door.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: God damn it Gus, you dug up my wife! What the fuck is going on around here?!

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDMAN
turns.text: I don't know what you expected to find, Matthews. There's nothing wrong with the antigens, nothing to indicate an unusual death...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Wait, there must be some mix-up. He was... the dog is alive.

turns.speaker: RUDMAN
turns.text: Not this dog. There wasn't enough oxygen in those red cells to pump life into a flea.

turns.speaker: RUDMAN
turns.text: You took over for Doctor Yolander?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Yes... why?

turns.speaker: RUDMAN
turns.text: Because the last person that sent me blood from a dead animal was Yolander...

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: Is something wrong?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Uh... no. You just... look different than you sounded on the phone. Please, come in.

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: I'm real excited about working for you Mr. Matthews...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Well we're glad to have you, Marjorie. You can call me Chase, by the way.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Out?

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: He's probably going up to the Pet Sematary. Kids've been going out there on Halloween night for years.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What do they do up there?

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: Oh, you know... drink beer, tell ghost stories. They try and spook each other out, talking about zombies and things...  It's no big deal, Chase. I did it when I was young.

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I had a little run-in with Zowie.

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: You sure did...

turns.speaker: MARJORIE
turns.text: I hope he doesn't have rabies.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: He doesn't. I don't know what he has, but I'm hoping to God it's not infectious...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: How long ago did this guy retire?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: It's been a few years.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What's wrong?!

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Nothing. I just got spooked by a bunch of furballs.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What's a lunch cost these days? You want ten?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You nervous? New town, new school. I know it must be pretty hard for you...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I'll be fine, Dad.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Hey! How was your first day at school?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: It sucked.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: You alright?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Your Mom and I loved each other, Geoff. Don't ever think that we didn't.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I still can't believe she's dead...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Remember Zowie, Drew's dog? He got hurt again. I'm going over to take a look at him.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Hey! Where're you off to?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I'm going out, Dad!

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Just out.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: "Out." Well that's great, Geoff.  Look, I've been letting you get away with a lot these past few weeks, but I'm not going to stand for crap like this. I don't care if it's Halloween... it's a school night, and if you do this again...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I'm really tired, Dad... can I just go to sleep?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Geoff, dinner's ready!  Geoff?!

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I'm not hungry.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I can bring her back. The same way Drew and me brought Zowie back...

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: Geoff, this is crazy. Zowie didn't die.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: He did. We buried him.  There's a place out in the woods... if you bury something there, it comes back alive.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: All set?

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: All set.

turns.speaker: CHASE
turns.text: So where're we going?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Anywhere but here.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Damn dog stuck his nose in on my rabbits and they ganged up on him. I swear that dog's an idiot.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Is he gonna be okay?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Drew, I don't remember inviting Zowie in for dinner.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Just until he heals up?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Not that much appreciation. I thought we were gonna tone down that flabby ass.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Hey, I'm so sorry I'm not the stud that you are.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Your momma's worried sick over you. You take off in the middle of the night, you don't show up for school. What're you trying to prove?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'm not trying to prove anything.  I was burying my dog.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Zowie...

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Say your goodbyes. Zowie's going outside. You're grounded, buddy. That's the new law.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Zowie.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I've never seen anybody punch Clyde before.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: He pissed me off.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Sorry about your mom.  I couldn't handle not having my mom around. Just having Gus...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I swear, sometimes I wish Gus was dead...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: You shouldn't ever say that about your parents, not even your Dad.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Stepdad. Gus is my stepdad.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What was all that stuff about dead people coming back to life?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Nothing. It's just an old ghost story. Let's get out of here...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Is this a good spot?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'm not burying him here...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: There's a better place...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: This is it... I wasn't sure if it even really existed.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What did?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: The old Indian burial ground.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Come on, that's just a bullshit story. You said so yourself...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: What if it's not bullshit? If I bury Zowie there, and it works...  ...he'll come back alive.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Drew, I know your dog died, but... get a grip, man, you're freaking me out.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Look, if there was even one chance in a million it'd work, wouldn't you want to try?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: You want me to help?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You have to bury your own. That's the way the Indians did it. It's like a rule...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I've never had anyone die before...  ...but I guess you get over it. I mean, eventually...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: You never get over it.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: It's getting pretty late. We better go.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Maybe he wasn't dead when we buried him.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: He was dead. You know he was.

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: You think my Dad'll figure out why he's not getting better?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You think he'd believe it if he did?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: How can he not have a heartbeat?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Maybe it takes a while...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: It's weird...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: It's like he's not Gus anymore. He's different. You know, like Zowie...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: What was that all about? You think he's trying to scare us?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I don't know but I'm not taking any chances...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Do you think everyone that came back would be like Gus?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I don't know...  ...maybe it depends on what you were like before you...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Dies?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I gotta go back and do my chores...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Go later...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You ever think about running away?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: All the time.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Geoff?  Anybody see my boy?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Right here, Mom...

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: How long have you been here?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Couple minutes. I saw the last shot. That was pretty cool.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: How did it go with your father last night?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Good. He said he'd be over for dinner at eight...  I mean... he misses you, Mom...

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I miss him too...

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: I know, Mom.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: You know everything, don't you?

turns.speaker: GEOFF
turns.text: Mom...

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I came back for you, Geoff. We're going to be together again.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Are we interrupting, Andy?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: In a word, Bob...

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Charles is right behind me.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: If MacroSystems wins, an energetic, young company will be destroyed, five thousand Americans will be out of work. Moreover, the laws of copyright and anti-trust were enacted to prevent exactly the kind of bullshit Macrosystems is trying to pull.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Andy, do you know who reps Kronos Inc.?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Bailey, Brackman.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: You'll have to get right on it, Andy, we're up against the statute of limitations.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I don't know what to do, Bob.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: You'll never find it in the dark.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: What in God's name... ?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Bob...

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: What's wrong with your face?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: What's wrong with my face? You want to know what's wrong with my face? I've got a skin condition. Next question, Bob? No more questions? Fine. Now can you help me find the complaint?

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Allright. Calm down.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Sorry...

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: What was the file name?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: K-R-O-one.

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Maybe you mistyped the name when you were saving it. We'll try combinations of those letters...

turns.speaker: SEIDMAN
turns.text: Do you really think so, Andy?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Yes, Bob, I do.  Excuse me? Am I being fired?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Why, Beckett?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Because they deserve to, Walter.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Thanks, Walter.

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: What's that on your forehead, pal?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Whacked with a racquetball.  I appreciate your faith in my abilities.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You're right, I probably just misfiled...

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Andy?

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: This time. What about next time?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: There won't be a next time, I guarantee it.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Perhaps... you're right. I've certainly been busy. With the Kronos complaint, a preliminary injunction hearing and the Saunders trial all falling at the same time...

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Some people think you have an attitude problem, Beckett.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Really? Who thinks that, sir?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Excuse me, Charles. With all due respect... this is... preposterous! It doesn't make any sense, it sounds as if we're talking about someone else. Pardon the lack of humility, but I've had the distinct impression I was kind of... one of the rising stars around here. And I feel that wasn't just my imagination. And I also think I deserve to know what's really going on here, Charles.

turns.speaker: KENTON
turns.text: Oh, you're right, Beckett, you don't have an attitude problem.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Thanks, you guys.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Yeah. Thanks, guys.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Aren't you giving an exam?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: I said, don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I almost didn't make it to the bathroom, Miguel. I almost lost control right in front of everybody.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: So what? It's nothing to be ashamed of. You have nothing to be ashamed of, okay?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: It could be parasites, an infection...

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: A reaction to AZT...

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Don't apologize for me.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: He's not sorry, okay, fine.  Why don't we see what we find out from the blood work? I'll work on getting a specimen, I'm sure hospital food could help in that direction. Maybe, by then, we'll hear from my doctor, and we'll go from there. Okay? Everybody happy?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: That's the third time. I better call the office.  Would you relax, please?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: I am relaxed.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Why are you getting dressed?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You're not going to like this. Please try to smile...

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Thanks for leaving school, and coming here, and...  I will be back. An hour, tops.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: You're going to the office?!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You're not smiling.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: You're leaving the hospital? You're going into the office looking like that? Are you insane?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: One hour!

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Drew!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I promise!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Jerk... What did you say?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: I said, "Everyone's going to die, Jimmy. But Drew's not going to die of AIDS. There's a cure around the corner, and he plans to be around to take advantage of it."

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You got that right, Mikey...  You still believe that, don't you?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Yes. I think it will be a simple solution. They'll put it in a syringe, inject it into your bloodstream. It'll neutralize the virus. It'll revitalize the immune system, and people with AIDS will become healthy again.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Hold still. Shit.  The goddamn vein's clotted. We have to go the goddamn hospital, so they can change the goddamn catheter.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I have too much work to do. Skip the treatment.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: We're not skipping this treatment.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I said, skip it, Michael. It's my treatment.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Fuck you. This shit's probably not doing me any good anyway.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: That shit's saving your life, you asshole!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Close the law book.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm not going to close the--

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: CLOSE THE FUCKING LAW BOOK!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: ALLRIGHT IT'S CLOSED!  Jesus!

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: The least you can do is look at me, while I'm sticking this shit into your arm. Forget the fucking case, one hour a day, and give me a little of your time.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You don't think there's much time left, do you?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: That's not what I said.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You're scared. You think we're near the end.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Maybe I should start making plans, is that what you think? Start planning my memorial service? "Begin to prepare for the inevitable."

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Maybe you should think about it.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: What's that mean?!

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Maybe you should think about it.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm not going to die.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: That's right. We're on the Positive Plan. You don't have a Fatal Disease, you have Manageable Illness.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You want me to give up? Let this thing turn us into <u>victims</u>?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Then, what <u>are</u> we, Drew?! The <u>winners</u>? "Ladies and gentlemen, the first prize of AIDS goes to Andrew Beckett and his lover Miguel..." Excuse me, I'm not your lover. I'm your Care Partner. FUCK!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm not ready to die.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Do you think I'm ready for it?! I hate this shit. I'm not a fucking martyr! I hate every goddamn part of it!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm ready...

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Ready for what, baby?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: I hope you're ready for "Studs," because that's what's on.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: It is, and it isn't, Charles. Macrosystem's new software copies all the best-known elements of Kronos' spreadsheet program. If they're allowed to sell it, Kronos will get undersold right out of business. For me, the legal principle, involved is copyright infringement.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Bearing in mind that Bill Wright, the chairman of MacroSystems, is a close, personal friend of mine... which side of this mess would <u>you</u> desire to be on, Andy? And don't allow my very tight, personal relationship with Bill to influence your answer in any way.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Thanks, Charles.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: No sweat, buddy.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Thanks for coming in.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I know that, Charles.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: More than your friend. Family.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: We've been talking it over, Andy. Your future that is... We feel that, because we respect you so much, we have to be honest with you.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Honesty is always best.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Take it easy, Walter.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: If you'd lost confidence in me, why did you give me the Kronos suit?

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: I hoped the challenge would improve your performance. You could say it was a carrot.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: A carrot?!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You can save it for the jury, Charles. I want to hear you say, under oath, in front of a judge and a jury, I'm a bad lawyer.  Gentlemen.  Counselor.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Don't do this, Andy.

turns.speaker: WHEELER
turns.text: Longstreet's interested in the Harrisburg deal.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm seeing him this afternoon.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Mr. Beckett, I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: About my blood work?

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: We're waiting...

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: ... meanwhile, I'd like to prepare you for a colonoscopy, so we can take a look inside.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Sounds delightful.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: This is my partner. We keep records of hospital visits. Nothing personal.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Dr. Klenstein.  It's not a pleasant procedure, but if the KS is causing the diarrhea, we ought to know right away.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: I'm trying to help your "partner." You're not a member of his immediate family, I could have you removed from the ER.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: He's upset, he's sorry.
